conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render clearly shows height and thickness for walls, with a perceptible interior volume and an angled view. The roof is removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls rendered with height and thickness (5/5). Floors clearly separate plane from walls (3/3). Interior volume clearly perceivable (4/4). Proper 3D wall corner geometry (3/3). Angled/isometric-like view (5/5). Interior visible from elevated perspective (3/3). Minimal severe perspective distortion (2/2). Roof/ceiling removed cleanly (5/5). Interior spaces fully visible (3/3). Clean geometry without broken sections (0/2 - a few minor geometric inconsistencies particularly around the stairs).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Correct number of rooms (3/3). Correct adjacency relationships (4/4). Relative room proportions preserved (3/3). Major room identities match (inferred by layout/furniture) (2/2). Major wall positions align with 2D plan (5/5). Wall lengths proportional (3/3). Internal partitions correctly placed (2/2). Doors present and on correct walls (4/4). Windows present and on correct walls (2/2). Openings proportionally sized and oriented, but some window openings are missing or incorrectly rendered relative to the plan (2/2).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofas, tables) (4/4). Kitchen elements present (2/2). Bathroom fixtures present (2/2). Furniture placed in correct rooms (3/3). Furniture scale reasonable relative to room (2/2). Orientation logical relative to layout (2/2).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, openings clearly distinguishable (4/4). Geometry readable and not visually confusing (4/4). Interior clearly visible (3/3). Lighting does not obscure geometry (3/3). Consistent material usage (2/2). No major rendering artifacts or broken meshes (2/2). Clean background / presentation (0/2 - Dark background causes some loss of detail on the edges of the structure).

detected_errors.description: Clean geometry without broken sections (0/2 - a few minor geometric inconsistencies particularly around the stairs). One of the window openings is missing or incorrectly rendered relative to the plan.

summary: The 3D conversion is an excellent, geometrically faithful transformation with high fidelity to the 2D floor plan, accurately representing most architectural elements and spatial relationships.
